meanings.definition: A garment that is pulled on over the head and covers the upper body.
meanings.sent1: She wore a cozy slipover during the chilly evening.
meanings.sent2: The slipover kept her warm on the walk home.
meanings.sent3: The slipover was so big on him, it looked like a tent!
meanings.sent4: Her slipover was like a hug from a soft cloud.
meanings.sent5: The bright red slipover stood out in the sea of jackets.

meanings.definition: To put on a slipover garment.
meanings.sent1: He would slipover his favorite sweater before heading out.
meanings.sent2: She slipovered the vest quickly before leaving the house.
meanings.sent3: Trying to slipover the tight shirt was a struggle.
meanings.sent4: She slipovered the jacket like a pro.
meanings.sent5: He slipovered the coat with a swift motion.

meanings.definition: A slipover garment that is sleeveless and worn over a shirt.
meanings.sent1: The blue slipover matched his jeans perfectly.
meanings.sent2: She loved wearing the slipover to picnics in the park.
meanings.sent3: The slipover was like a stylish cape for her.
meanings.sent4: Her slipover was a pop of color in the monochrome outfit.
meanings.sent5: The slipover added a touch of elegance to her ensemble.
